channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 国际刑事法院周二对两名俄罗斯高级军官发出逮捕令，指控他们在乌克兰以平民为目标并破坏重要的能源基础设施，犯有战争罪。
item.description:
The International Criminal Court on Tuesday issued arrest warrants for two top Russian military officers, accusing them of war crimes in Ukraine for targeting civilians and destroying crucial energy infrastructure. https://t.co/rUrvuXNlNE

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 6, 2024

item.title: 我曾写过一篇文章，讲述了为什么中国政府取消了高度照本宣科的总理记者招待会，对中国公众和更广泛的世界来说是一件大事。它的取消抹去了改革时代的最后痕迹。
item.description:
I wrote about why it’s such a big deal for the Chinese public and the wider world that the Chinese government cancelled the highly scripted press conference with the premier. Its demise erased the last vestiges of the reform era. https://t.co/NXutlwtzpJ

— Li Yuan袁莉 (@LiYuan6) March 6, 2024

item.title: 7 月 28 日举行投票的决定部分履行了对美国的承诺，但由于反对党头号人物被禁止参加投票，许多人不禁要问投票的自由和公平程度如何，拜登政府是否会重新实施制裁。
item.description:
The decision to hold a vote July 28 is a partial fulfillment of a commitment to the United States, but with the top opposition figure barred, many wondered how free and fair the balloting would be and if the Biden administration would reimpose sanctions. https://t.co/uz26nklwpC

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 6, 2024

item.title: 里卡多-马蒂内利（Ricardo Martinelli）因对一项定罪和判刑提出异议而被选举官员取消资格
item.description:
Ricardo Martinelli was disqualifed by electoral officials over a conviction and sentence that he disputes https://t.co/k1INkECqvj

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 6, 2024

item.title: 英国的编辑们一直在努力平衡他们对报道王室的热情--几乎是无尽的热情--与对英国大多数公众人物在健康问题上一般都享有隐私权的认识。
item.description:
British editors have struggled to balance their zeal for covering the royals — an almost boundless enthusiasm — with a recognition that even most public figures in Britain are generally entitled to privacy in matters of health https://t.co/Hemp61UHs2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 英国的编辑们一直在努力平衡他们对报道王室的热情--几乎是无尽的热情--与对英国大多数公众人物在健康问题上一般都享有隐私权的认识。
item.description:
British editors have struggled to balance their zeal for covering the royals — an almost boundless enthusiasm — with a recognition that even most public figures in Britain are generally entitled to privacy in matters of health https://t.co/MSzEHzTqk8

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 联合国巴勒斯坦难民机构负责人周一证实，数百名巴勒斯坦人报告了在以色列拘留期间遭受虐待的情况，并回答了有关该机构进行的一项未公开调查的问题。
item.description:
The head of the United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees confirmed Monday that hundreds of Palestinians had reported abuse under Israeli detention, responding to a question about an unpublished investigation it had conducted. https://t.co/GeUgfeWoUL

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 在 20 世纪 90 年代的经济动荡中，中国工业中心地带的数百万劳动者失去了工作。犯罪率和贫困率上升。双雪涛是中国最著名的青年作家之一，他的散文中充满了这种集体苦难的遗产。
item.description:
In the economic upheaval of the 1990s, millions of laborers in China’s industrial heartland lost their jobs. Crime and poverty rose. The legacy of that communal suffering animates the prose of Xuetao Shuang, one of China’s most celebrated young authors. https://t.co/feujRaLisR

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 周五，从南美到北美移民之路的一个重要环节重新开放，允许数百名被滞留在哥伦比亚的移民继续他们的旅程。
item.description:
A critical link in the migration path from South to North America reopened on Friday, permitting hundreds of migrants who were held up in Colombia to resume their trek. https://t.co/rPghwbv52a

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 国际艺术品交易商盖伊-威尔登斯坦（Guy Wildenstein）在法国被判犯有巨额税务欺诈罪，此前多年的法律纠纷揭开了其强大家族王朝的神秘面纱。
item.description:
Guy Wildenstein, the international art dealer, was found guilty in France of massive tax fraud, after years of legal entanglements that unraveled the secrecy that once surrounded his powerful family dynasty. https://t.co/EtQlDRV6u5

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 建筑师费尔南达-卡纳莱斯（Fernanda Canales）设计了七座新的市政建筑，包括图书馆、老年人中心和体育场馆，旨在为墨西哥的社区营造一种社区和安全的氛围。
item.description:
Con siete nuevos edificios cívicos, entre los cuales hay una biblioteca, un centro para adultos mayores y complejos deportivos, la arquitecta Fernanda Canales intenta crear una atmósfera de comunidad y seguridad en comunidades de México. https://t.co/9kWPiuNoDU

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 从表面上看，中国立法机构的年度会议似乎又回到了疫情爆发前的时代。但从那时起，中国已经发生了很大变化。
item.description:
The annual meeting of China’s legislature looked, on its surface, like a return to the prepandemic days. But much has changed about the country since then. https://t.co/oKKMlLhplx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 在经历了两年的经济危机后，埃及陷入了疯狂的黄金投机活动。
item.description:
After two years of economic crisis, Egypt has been gripped by a frenzy of gold speculation. https://t.co/Ako4Fe5laU

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 在全国人民代表大会上，中国领导人制定了与去年完全相同的宏伟经济目标。以下是一些启示。
item.description:
At the National People’s Congress, China’s leaders set exactly the same ambitious economic goal as last year.

Here are some takeaways. https://t.co/shdytFHtgl

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 与印度和中国这两个世界上人口最多的国家相比，马尔代夫几乎算不上一个小国。然而，在这两个巨头争夺南亚影响力的竞争中，每一个小插曲都很重要，而这也让马尔代夫在它们之间徘徊。
item.description:
The Maldives barely registers as a blip alongside India and China, the world’s most populous nations. Yet every blip counts in the two giants’ competition for influence across South Asia, and that has set the Maldives on a zigzagging course between them. https://t.co/oMOhM97Dch

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯最近在乌克兰东部取得的战果得益于前线冒险的近距离空中支援。在过去两周里，这也帮助乌克兰击落了敌机。
item.description:
Russia’s recent gains in eastern Ukraine have been aided by risky close air support on the front lines. That has also helped Ukraine shoot down enemy planes in the past two weeks. https://t.co/4wa2dwHwkC

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 中国最高领导人为 2024 年的经济增长制定了宏伟目标，他们试图增强人们对这个面临数十年来最大挑战的经济体的信心。但他们宣布的刺激经济增长的措施并不多。
item.description:
China’s top leaders set an ambitious goal for economic growth in 2024 as they tried to bolster conviction in an economy facing its biggest challenges in decades. But they announced only modest measures to stimulate growth. https://t.co/LKPUquA9wF

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 5, 2024

item.title: 都柏林波希米亚人俱乐部将支持社会事业作为其身份的重要组成部分。批评者认为这支球队受到了时髦人士的摆布，但这种做法吸引了来自世界各地的支持者。 作者：@RorySmith
item.description:
El club Bohemians de Dublín ha hecho del apoyo a las causas sociales una parte clave de su identidad. Los críticos dicen que el equipo está a merced de los hípsters, pero el enfoque ha atraído a hinchas de todo el mundo.https://t.co/oF1EP2S4By por @RorySmith

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 4, 2024

item.title: 一些加沙家庭在周日步行南下，他们说在北部很难获得粮食援助。"一位父亲说："我们已经到了忍无可忍的饥饿阶段。联合国专家警告说，加沙已接近饥荒。实时更新：
item.description:
Some Gazan families were walking south on Sunday, saying it was too hard to get food aid in the north. “We reached a stage of hunger that we couldn't tolerate anymore,” one father said. UN experts warn that Gaza is close to famine. Live updates: https://t.co/6mPmMlT4u0

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 4, 2024

item.title: 加拿大政府的一项预测显示，今年的野火季节将比 2023 年创纪录的野火季节更糟糕。据报道，一个冬季从未发生过如此多的 "僵尸火灾"，这让人担心其中许多火灾可能会在地面上再次爆发。
item.description:
A Canadian government forecast suggests this year’s wildfire season will be worse than the record-breaking season of 2023. Never have so many “zombie fires” been reported in a single winter, raising fears that many of them may flare up again above ground. https://t.co/0KUYzgvgDf

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 4, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：法国投票决定将堕胎权利明确写入宪法，成为世界上第一个这样做的国家。美国最高法院决定于 2022 年推翻 "罗伊诉韦德 "案，推动了这一变革。
item.description:
Breaking News: France voted to explicitly enshrine access to abortion in its Constitution, making it the first country in the world to do so. The impulse for the change was the decision by the U.S. Supreme Court to overturn Roe v. Wade in 2022. https://t.co/lMDiQFvAAG

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 4, 2024

item.title: 美国官员说，让墨西哥采取更多措施阻止毒品流动的策略之一，就是表明芬太尼不仅会让美国人上瘾：它还会杀死墨西哥人。
item.description:
Una estrategia para conseguir que México haga más para frenar el flujo de drogas, dicen las autoridades de EE. UU., es demostrar que el fentanilo no es sólo una adicción estadounidense: también está matando mexicanos. https://t.co/C7diCSEDnR

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 4, 2024

item.title: 在实习生和居民反对韩国政府增加医学院招生计划的抗议活动持续数周之后，韩国当局表示将暂停数千名医生的执照。
item.description:
After weeks of protests from interns and residents opposed to a South Korean government plan to increase medical school admissions, the authorities said they were moving to suspend the licenses of thousands of doctors. https://t.co/WaZj4GQYZr

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 4, 2024

item.title: 中国政府宣布，中国总理将不再在中国年度立法会议后举行新闻发布会，这结束了长达三十年之久的惯例，而这一惯例一直是记者与中国领导人互动的极为难得的机会。
item.description:
China’s premier will no longer hold a news conference after the country’s annual legislative meeting, Beijing announced, ending a three-decades-long practice that had been an exceedingly rare opportunity for journalists to interact with Chinese leaders. https://t.co/CVO7cAuX7K

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 4, 2024

item.title: 法国立法者预计将于周一通过一项措施，使法国成为世界上第一个将堕胎权利明确写入宪法的国家。
item.description:
French legislators are expected to pass a measure on Monday that would make France the first country in the world to explicitly enshrine access to abortion in its Constitution. https://t.co/RaxbH6txU9

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 4, 2024

item.title: 先是法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙，然后是德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨，这暴露了试图避免与俄罗斯直接敌对的西方国家之间的分歧。
item.description:
First President Emmanuel Macron of France, then Chancellor Olaf Scholz of Germany, exposed divisions among Western countries trying to avoid direct hostilities with Russia. https://t.co/jMHAX1DPEl

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 4, 2024

item.title: 2019 年一座火山岛喷发后，受害者及其家属共获得了约 1020 万新西兰元的赔偿，约合 620 万美元。
item.description:
After a volcanic island erupted in 2019, victims and their families have been awarded a total of about 10.2 million New Zealand dollars, or roughly $6.2 million. https://t.co/mddiJxhngE

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 贝蒂-菲切特是领导瑞士钟表品牌宝珀的第一位女性，她以创新思维带领宝珀度过了动荡时期。她还发现了女式手表的市场，并设计出玛丽莲-梦露佩戴过的手表。
item.description:
Betty Fiechter was the first woman to lead a Swiss watch brand, Blancpain, which she shepherded through turmoil with her innovative thinking. She also recognized a market for women’s watches and created a watch worn by Marilyn Monroe. https://t.co/ESeSKC0mNv

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 他的女儿问他是否见过 BTS。但这位来自孟加拉国的外来务工人员在韩国的一家纺织厂工作，每周六天，从晚上 7 点工作到早上 7 点，而这家纺织厂尚未支付他承诺的工资。
item.description:
His daughter asks him whether he had met BTS yet. But the migrant worker from Bangladesh works from 7 p.m. to 7 a.m., six days a week, in a textile factory in South Korea that has yet to pay him the wages it promised. https://t.co/JoWiq2duJR

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024

item.title: 每次核交战的目的都是一样的：弗拉基米尔-普京知道，他的对手最担心乌克兰冲突升级。
item.description:
Cada caso de beligerancia nuclear ha cumplido la misma función: Vladimir Putin sabe que sus oponentes son los que más temen una escalada del conflicto en Ucrania. https://t.co/EuglWVer5S

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 3, 2024
